Reviewer_Content: It was watchable and the armchair critics who gave this 1 star well you have to wonder why they are watching it in the first place? No mystery here you know whats coming. Whether its as good as Cube or not really who cares.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This movie is a well thought out story concept with good visuals but hurt by terrible acting and plot holes throughout, a good watch for people who like puzzle thrillers.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: In effect this series of movies are an update of "Saw". Which in some regards is not a bad thing as they have more finesse and less over the top gore

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Dear Mr. Filmmakers, please stop starting your movies with scenes from the end to have an exciting beginning and build suspense. It doesn't work and it's been done to death to the point that now it only spoils part of your movie. Thank you. After this small rant let's talk about the movie. Escape Room borrows many of its concepts from other movies, but that's not necessarily a bad thing because there aren't that many high concept movies like this, and, for me, they usually work. It is an intriguing idea and makes for an entertaining ride, with some good escape room concepts and many suspenseful moments, which never make the movie boring. The characters are a bit flat and the acting isn't Oscar worthy, but that's not very important here. Another odd choice, following the horrendous spoiler opening, is the decision of only giving background on three of the characters. I would've much preferred if they had started the movie with them already in the escape room or, if you need to pad your runtime, at least give background on all of the characters or otherwise you can more or less guess who's dying first. Which brings us to the elephant in the room which is the ending (light spoilers ahead). The problem with these kind of movies is that it's very hard for the writers to come up with a satisfying ending, you either explain everything and leave many viewers disappointed because you can't deliver on the intriguing concept or you don't explain anything, leaving it to the viewer's imagination with many people complaining that it's an easy cop out. It's a bit damned if you do and damned if you don't, what I call the J.J. Abrams conundrum. This one tries the third route with a totally over the top and unbelievable ending, which is so insane that they hope people won't even stop to think how absurd everything was, while at the same time setting up a sequel, again a sin most people don't like. All in all I had fun with the movie with the exception of the beginning and ending and can recommend the movie for what it is.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Or Cube meets Saw - sort of. I have not been to an Escape Room yet, but I do hope they are not like this ... the movie sets the mood from the start though! We get to see what the people who get involved in this have to face. And let me tell you: it is grim and it is violent! So not for the faint of hearted as you should be able to tell.It is tough to comment on acting, because this puts its characters in extreme situations (literally) and that is where it draws its drama from. If that sounds like something you like to see and experience (in movie form that is, completely seperated from reality), then the movie is something for you to watch. And everyone involved does a great job. Effects are good and even though we have to have token bad and good people, the chemistry also works overall

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: After time and time and time, i found a good movie that occupied my attention. End is little stupid, but i love this movie.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: These days, everyone is trying an escape room, so it is very appropriate to have a scary movie about one, I was told this was a pretty decent film, directed by Adam Robitel (Insidious: The Last Key). Basically, six strangers with varied backgrounds are sent a puzzle cube, each solve it, and are invited by the Minos Corporation to take part in an escape room with a $10,000 prize. These six people are physics student Zoey Davis (Taylor Russell), wealthy daytrader Jason Walker (Jay Ellis), grocery store stock boy Ben Miller (Logan Miller), truck driver Mike Nolan (Tyler Labine), Iraq War veteran Amanda Harper (True Blood's Deborah Ann Woll), and gamer and escape room enthusiast Danny Khan (Nik Dodani). The participants arrive at an office block and gather in the waiting room, waiting for the Gamemaster to arrive, but nobody comes. Ben tries to leave, but the door handle falls off, revealing that the challenge has begun. The room turns out to be a giant oven that begins to heat up. The players discover how to unlock an escape passage, using weight activated table coasters, and climb out before the room is filled with fire. Danny is convinced that it is still a game, and there is no foul play. Next the group find themselves in a winter cabin, where Ben deduces how to open the door. They step out into a room that appears to be an icy wilderness, with a small wood and a large lake, one jacket to keep them warm, and the temperature is dropping. Trying to find the key or a way out, Danny falls through the ice and drowns. They find the key, which is trapped in a block of ice, they use their body temperature to melt it down. Some players notice reminders of their traumatic events of the past. The remaining five players enter an upside-down billiards bar, where parts of the floor periodically fall into a deep shaft below. They realise the room contains a giant sliding puzzle, and the missing 8 ball is the key. Amanda retrieves the ball and throws it to Jason before plummeting to her death. The next room is a hospital ward with six beds, each representing a player. It is revealed that all of the six players were each sole survivors of various disasters: Ben survived a car crash, Jason escaped a shipwreck, Mike escaped a collapsed mine, Zoey survived a plane crash, Danny survived when his family died of carbon monoxide poisoning, and Amanda survived an IED blast. Zoey deduces that the purpose of the game is to determine which player is the luckiest of all. Jason discovers that the room is about to be filled with poisonous gas. Zoey refuses to continue playing and instead destroys the room's surveillance cameras. It is suggested that someone needs to record a certain heart rate for the players to escape. Mike has the highest heart rate, but not high enough to work. Jason suggests using the defibrillator on an unwilling Mike, Jason manipulates him by mentioning the mining tragedy. Jason accidentally kills Mike with a shock. He then solves the puzzle when the gas is released. Jason and Ben escape, but Zoey refuses to follow and disappears into the gas. Jason and Ben enter a room with optical illusions and strobe lights. While drugged with a hallucinogen, they fight over an antidote. Ben kills Jason and injects himself with the antidote. He then falls into the last room, where a wall moves inwards to crush him. Meanwhile, in the hospital room, the escape room employees enter to dispose of the dead bodies. Zoey jumps up and attacks them. Ben solves the last room and meets The Gamemaster, WooTan Yu (Yorick van Wageningen), who controls the game that the Puzzle Maker designed. The Gamemaster explains that each year they lure in players with something in common, and wealthy viewers bet on the result. The Gamemaster tries to kill Ben, but Zoey intervenes, and together they kill The Gamemaster. As Ben recovers, Zoey returns to the building with a detective. The police do not believe Zoey, as all evidence of the game has disappeared. Ben is not believed either, as drugs are detected in his system. While looking at the graffiti on the wall, Zoey notices the words "No Way Out", an anagram for "Wootan Yu", suggesting the game is not over. Six months later, Zoey meets up with Ben. Newspapers have passed off the other players' deaths as accidents. Ben suggests they should move on, but Zoey refuses to do so. Ben agrees to join Zoey as they travel to Manhattan to follow clues that point to an unlisted building. However, the mysterious Puzzle Maker is already preparing to make their flight a new deadly game of survival. Also starring Kenneth Fok as Detective Li. Russell, Miller and the others give strong performances, a familiar day experience for families and friends is twisted into a dark and twisted mystery, the pace of this film almost never slows down, it is definitely the elaborate rooms that create the most excitement, especially the upside down room, a satisfactory enough horror thriller. Worth watching!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room Starts off with three different strangers getting invitation to the Escape Room. Then out of nowhere three different other strangers appeared. Where in the world did they come from? They were hardly introduced. But somehow all six of them were linked to something. The Escape Room scenes was extremely impressive and intense. Totally grabs your attention.Then comes the final act and you would feel ready that everything would come together and the bad guy would reveal himself/herself. Sorry no spoilers. Someone just appears out of nowhere, Everything just got confusing, and then you question wtf? Weak ending with a weak story. That's your movie for today. Left you disappointed but relaxed.Just don't go to this movie with high hopes that it's good. Yeah it's felt disappointed, but at least the Escape Room scenes was really good fun to watch.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room is another feature that is trying to start a franchise by keeping the budget down, so it doesn't have to gross a ton to break the bank (or to get the approval for the sequel). Normally, this might be considered a negative, but I think the creative team did an excellent job with the set design and the visual work for the traps. Each of them is frightening or pushes the envelope and the work done on them was good enough that I wasn't constantly questioning the logistics or how certain facets of the traps were plausible or implausible. They look great for a movie with a smaller budget and it was a pleasant surprise.The escape rooms not only looked great, but I also really enjoyed the design of the traps and how the puzzle pieces fit together on how to solve them. It showed some imagination from the screenwriter, director and puzzle designer and the unpredictability sold the danger in each environment. The scarier elements of each room really show off how much potential this premise has (if you can forgive the fact it has similarities to Saw and Cabin in the Woods). Some levels in the game are stronger than others (my least favourite was the ice room) but I also liked how the solutions to the problems incorporated teamwork and outside the box thinking. Again, there's a surprising amount of inspired work in Escape Room and I appreciated that effort instead of just phoning it in.While there's some interesting elements to the problems and environments our characters face, I wish the same detail had been applied to the script. The main group (comprised of 6-7 people) are all distinctive but they can't escape cliché when it comes to their personalities. We have the nerd, the pretty boy jerk, the social outcast etc. and I had hoped they would transcend such simple descriptions. As we find out more about them, you can understand how they're all bitter and why they don't want to trust each other but I think they could have worked a little harder on creating more unique characters. This is made worse by the dialogue being a little stilted. Almost all the jokes in this fall flat and it makes it harder to bond and root for our heroes (or villains depending on which character you're talking about).Escape Room follows in the foot steps of other horror franchises like Saw and Final Destination in its premise, the plot progression and ultimately the actors and actresses they cast. I've already mentioned that Escape Room looks great on a modest budget, but it also follows the proud tradition of hiring so-so actors to fill out the cast. I thought there was 1 clear standout performance and it came from Deborah Ann Woll as Amanda Harper. The participants/players in Escape Room are neither pure victims or virtuous heroes but Deborah shone through and brought the most emotion to her arc as Amanda. I kept hoping she was going to get more screen time and she did the best she could with what could have been a very forgettable character. Tyler Labine was the next best, he's a good character actor and while they desperately needed to punch up his dialogue, he still managed to get a couple of genuine laughs out of me and he had a few effective dramatic moments. I think the rest of the main cast (Taylor Russell, Logan Miller, Jay Ellis and Nik Dodani) were okay but they played a little too far into type. For example, Taylor is a little too reserved, Jay is too mean without any provocation and Nik Dodani is forced to keep playing the same note in his acting repertoire. They aren't helped by the dialogue and character development, but they all get the job done.Escape Room benefits mostly from a great premise and low expectations. My best friend recommended this to me, and his recommendation carries weight. That's what convinced me to go see it. The puzzle design, the interesting set pieces and the overall look of the movie carry it past some of the more implausible moments and while the acting is a mixed bag, the cast does what they can while the material and dialogue try to drag them down. The ending features a nice twist, but it risks pushing the movie into some goofy territory to setup a sequel. I would love to see a sequel to Escape Room, it would give them a chance to build off this debut feature and further shape the idea into a really good movie (e.g. how they took the original Purge movie and drastically expanded on the idea in the sequels). I would give Escape Room a 7.5/10 for delivering a better than expected horror thriller but I can't go all the way to 8/10 because of some of the bigger problems. I'll round down to a 7/10. Its worth checking out but if you can't catch it in the theatre, I think you could stream it at home and have a good time.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Whenever a thriller is rated PG-13, I have doubts. However, the first minute of this film keeps you on the edge of your seat, where you stay unti the end. The intensity of the film caused my anxiety to go crazy! The plot also seemed like something that could have been a hit or miss. There have been many films similar to this one, but this one does a nice job of adding never before seen elements. I do have to say, once it got to the point with the final two characters (the drug sequence) it fell a little bit for me. I would still see the sequel though. Another thing that amazed me was the quality of the cinematography and editing. Visually captivating and disturbing. Lastly, I have to give credit to the cast. For not being very well known actors, they all managed to stay in character and portray the feelings of that chaotic experience. Definitely will be watching again!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This movie is far better than it has any right to be, honestly. Except for the last, maybe 2 minutes? That could have been done a LOT better.A cast of relative unknowns join Deborah Ann Woll and Tyler Labine (frankly the only reasons I started watching this to begin with) for a Saw-style Escape Room movie in a shock twist, considering the title of the movie. I mean, who would have EVER thought that a movie called Escape Room would be about a series of Escape Rooms? Yeah, me neither.Anyway, for a movie that could very easily have been overly derivative and predictable as F, it really was surprisingly good. The tension was great, it distracted well from the relatively predictable story, and the relative unknowns - Nik Dodani, Taylor Russell, Jay Ellis, and Logan Miller - held their own pretty well alongside the more established Deborah Ann Woll and Tyler Labine. It's kind of a shame we didn't get to see more of them, but that would have been a very different movie, I guess.Long story short, you could do a LOT worse to fill your time than watching this.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: First of all, this movie is fun to watch. The movie feels fresh to me. It keep me at the edge of my seat for most of the movie. The suspense is good but what it lack is that it is maybe too predictable?

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This movie was better then expected. It put me in the mind of Final Destination and Saw...?however it didn't finish strong and I lost interest probably like the last 15 to 20 in the end.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Thriller / escape movie. Although many movies of this kind have been released with similar content, this one is definitely one of the best. Escape rooms well, but not just a simple game, rather a struggle for survival against time. Unsuspecting "players" must discover the puzzles of each room against time and before they get killed from its deadly traps. Unknown to each other players should cooperate fully, stay as cool as possible but most importantly, hurry because otherwise everyone will die. The movie has really clever puzzles, plenty of suspense from start to finish and twists. In addition to the excellent direction and convincing acting, another positive thing is the fact that it deepens in each character of the film, so that the viewers can better correlate with the players and their struggle for survival. In the end it leaves room for an equally good sequel. It is definitely recommended and it is watched again and again with same interest! A reference film in this concept!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Let's talk about the elephant in the room first , yes this has been done before and better. Playing off of established ideas from movies like Cube and Saw the film tries to set a path all it's own, and for the most part it does but ultimately it falls back on some of those movies styles and troupes,while the script starts to fall apart . The movie gets going once it enters its first escape room and it's pretty intense as it moves along from room to room . Amazing set designs and interesting ideas involving each characters backstories scattered throughout the puzzles really help this . The actors also really are well casted , except for the main jerk of the bunch who's acting and dialogue get old fast and the troupes of the rich jerk seem tired and a little bizarre at times. Another problem is the directing on some of the flashbacks which feel very fake and don't match the rest of the movie. The film also begins with a flashforward kind of ruining some of the twists. The biggest problem is the end , it doesnt end , its sequel bait ,something these films have to learn to do better . end on an interesting twist involving our characters , don't add scene after scene ... it really ruined the momentum. And also kind of ruins the film. But I will admit when it's good, it's pretty good . Because of that it's worth a look.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I didn't enjoy it as good film. Obviously it isn't. Anyway, I'll say that if I had watched it in my twenties when anything could surprise me and I must admit this one would have, I'd give an 8at least. That said, a movie to watch on a lazy Sunday afternoon with a hangover just gone and noting else to worry about but having a good time with friends on a VHS tape from Blockbuster.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I got surprised with that movie, it's the traps are pretty well done, and you really care about the characters, because one by one have your moment, the deaths isn't cruel, but still are good, and you get terrified all moments waiting what will the next trap and what will happens. When come to the end starts something that someone's can hate it, but I thought that was smart and surprising.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Very much like "Cube" yet a PG Film,ending was not the best but an all good thrill ride.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This movie reminds me of both Saw and Cube, but those movies are much better than this one. The only two things I really liked about the movie was the design of the rooms and the pacing, so I was never really bored during the movie, but it had alot of other stuff that bothered me too much. The deaths of the characters was not that amusing. The dialogue was bad from time to time. The movie felt like PG-13. How did Zoe survive the poisonous gas? And when Zoe is fighting the Games Master, he runs away and just disappears. There is a good camera angle of the room where they are fighting, so we can see the whole room, and there is NOWHERE that he could possibly hide. Suddenly, he just appears and tackles Zoe. Where did he come from?!And then we have the ending... When Zoe is going with the police to the building where it all happened, they go to the first room, which is the room that was completely burned. She explains that things used to be in certain places before it burned, like the painting with the ventilation shaft behind it that they used to escape the room. The police says that there is no evidence of that, and that's it for the police, their work there is done... Wait, what? No questions were asked, they just gave up and had to leave the premises. Lmao... The movie ends with the chance of a sequel, and the ending was really unoriginal and bad in my opinion. I was hoping that the characters did not actually die. Like the guy that went through the ice, that maybe he got washed away safely. And the girl that fell to her death, that she landed on something soft etc. I was hoping that it was all leading up to a big twist, something that you did not expect, or like in the movie The Game (1997) that it was all fake.I'll give it a 5/10. It was watchable and had some excitement, but the ending was too bad. Would not watch it again.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: So many possibilities with less effort yet utilized very few. Pacing issues, poorly written dialogues and lazy performances. The Weakest batch of actors, not you Deborah Ann Woll, you're too precious.I hope the sequel will be better than this borefest.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room centers on six strangers who must uncover wickedly designed puzzles and overcome life-threatening challenges set in hazardous environments, with plenty of twists and turns.Went in without watching trailers or reading any background info on it. The acting was great with good character development - but more importantly this film has excellent writing. The film never got boring. A very clever drawing influences from Saw (2004), and Cube (1997) ; with modern escape rooms. The production design on this film is fantastic. "Escape Room" is edge of your seat right from the opening frame. Loved it ! Non-stop action from beginning to end. Highly suggest "Escape Room" if you like a suspenseful thriller, horror, action movie.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Honestly, take any horror movie review on this app with a grain of salt, it's like the only people that leave reviews are people who aren't horror fans.This movie is great, I love the story, the execution and the actors, more than worth a watch.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Six strangers attempt to find their way out of a series of "escape Rooms". Most of them are extremely unlikeable, yet all apparently possess the most brilliant of minds, as they proceed to move from one room to the next, solving complicated and seemingly random clues within a few minutes. None of this helps them though, and of course they get picked off by one in various creative ways. The rooms themselves were also very visually appealing and the best part of the movie.However, things just fall apart in the final escape room with freedom supposedly attained. And that's where the movie fell apart too. Rubbish from then on.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: If you like Saw, Final Destination, Prison Break, video games, VR/AR, Game Theory, Prisoners' Dilemma, and the Uncertainty Principle in quantum physics, you will enjoy this awesome fun thriller. The actions, the set, and the acting are all excellent.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: The special effects were well-done, I liked the actors, it was thrilling and fun. I am sick of movies with love scenes or sex or even too much ridiculous gore. A good movie doesn't need all of that to keep people interested.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: It starts great and u get sucked in, but the last 5 min destroy the hole movie, not worth seeing at all...

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This is a suspenseful puzzle film as a group of seemingly unrelated people try to escape the "escape room" (really more like a building) without being killed.. Has some seriously inventive traps (like "Saw" only with a PG-13 rating and a bit more smarts). A decent cast, some of which are more familiar than others, helps make it worthwhile viewing.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: It's not going to win any awards, it's not going to be up there with dramas like Shawshank redemption or Forrest Gump. It is what it is, Not really serious horror but more a funhouse horror with satisfying changes of environment for interesting screen aesthetic that keeps your attention. The set design was creative and great in my opinion. Character interactions that were entertaining enough to fill space. And genuinely suspenseful scenes where I enjoyed theorizing who was next. I've been a fan of the genre for a long time, so long that I have sub-genres for horror in my mind, and again this is a great example of successful "Funhouse horror". Easily one of the better horror films I've seen in a year or so.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: We enjoyed this movie. I watched it, so I could understand the sequel. It basically is non stop thrills, surprises and creativity. The acting is not Oscar level, however the main and co star were decent which led me to watch the sequel immediately.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Not worth a moment of your time. It is so stupid that anyone giving this more than a 5 is a fake review

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: But i watched it because its my KIND of movie. and wow was it good, especially the ending.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I love how the escape room veteran Danny reminds the audience how lame escape rooms are to contrast it with the real life escape room with actual consequences we get in this movie. It makes the entire movie more fun as you watch the characters solve the puzzles as they try to stay alive. I also liked the fact that the six members of this party were not all kids, something that you certainly could have had in a PG13 suspense film. I thought all six of the characters were good, but I really enjoyed Deborah Ann Woll (Daredevil), who I thought added some gravitas to, again, a PG13 suspense film. It's a fun movie.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: It's a great movie to watch, it reminds you of Saw but not as gory. It definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. If you ever have done an escape room, you will understand the concept of this movie better, which makes you feel like you're playing the game as well.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I've been viewing horror films since I was about five. They scared me. They gave me nightmares. Terrified me. But ever since the 2010s hit I've seen nothing but CGI made, no love, and quick to make a buck movies. This movie should've been on Syfy or something. Not the big screen, leave that up to the actual indie horror movies like "Assassination Nation". This film was predicatable, low budgeted, and the acting was so bleak and wasn't believable. Truly a shame to the horror industry.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: We enjoyed this one. Went with a group of 6 and saw it in an otherwise empty theater on a Monday night. Ten times better than the last flick we saw, VICE. This has you on the edge of your seat as things are revealed along the way until the entire puzzle comes together in the end. Reminded me a little of CABIN IN THE WOODS. SEE THIS

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Very scary movie. This is one of the scariest movies ever. It is scarier then A Nightmare on elm street. It has a great story line. and great acting. It one of the scariest movies I haves. seen.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
+ saw vibes
+ interesting conceptterrible actingcharacters are way too bland and clichêIt's not just the characters, but the writing, the dialogues, it doesn't blend. It's a bit cringe sometimes even, and even their personalities don't blend well, it just feels forced most of the time. It's a shame the writing and the actors are so bad because the environments look really cool, it's a really interesting concept that isn't that popular, and I like how it there's saw vibes on it, that classic.I really dislike the concept of the character that is a secret genius without proving its worth, it's just too unrealistic to be interesting or anything else more than bland.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room isn't a horror-film, let's be very clear about that. It's a thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat.The film opens by introducing half of the strangers we're about to get locked up with. Zoey (Taylor Russell) is a timid, intelligent college student who's been through some kind of trauma in her past. Jason (Jay Ellis - Insecure) is a confident yet cocky stock broker with a fight-or-die attitude. Ben (Logan Miller - Love, Simon) doesn't really know what he wants to be when he grows up, so losing himself in alcohol and chainsmoking is kind of his thing, in the meantime he works in the backroom of a hardware store. All of these people receive a gift from what seems to be people they work or study with. Once they crack open the invitation box itself, it points them into the direction of the location where the rest of the story will take place.Once arrived, we meet our other three contestants. Amanda (Deborah Ann Woll - Daredevil) is an Iraq veteran, Mike (Tyler Labine) the truck driver and Danny (Nik Dodani - Atypical) our escape room enthusiast. Before truly realising it, the game has already begun, and it becomes very clear that this is gonna be a fight-for-survival kinda game. Real flames, real hypothermia, real heights to fall from and so on.. But the game has some secrets of its own, especially Zoey seems to notice little references to events in their lives.There isn't any blood-splashing or limb-cutting present, but there are enough other ways to keep the tension building all the way to the end. This partially has to do with the exquisite art direction. Every escape room has its own soul and environment that looks expensive: a room that turns into a human-sized oven, a cabin in a snowy landscape where every step might cause you to freeze to death, an upside down bar. Every escape room breathes atmosphere and the creators have spend attention to detail.The script gets a little bit funny at times because you know it all takes place in a building - or does it?! - but a little round of applause to writers Maria Melnik and Bragi Schut is definitely deserved. It never feels like these are just some set pieces and they all have to die at some point, because you actually don't know what might or might not happen to them. Some might be displeased with the final reveal, but for me it felt like the studio knew what they were going for and yes, building up for a sequel that might or might not get made in the future. I wouldn't mind that all. Let's say, BRING IT!Escape Room could've easily been some sort of twist to revive the Saw-franchise, but I'm happy it isn't. Tight, fun little thriller with some spectacular vertigo inducing set pieces.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: We suppose that the escape rooms are only physical that they are so far, but in this movie such rooms went into the game universe framework. So we can't understand what are we watching a escape room or a game? Such thing takes us in a big confusion zone i.e. what is actual and what is imagination of game? Some contestants had already died, then how they entered into escape room again and died again? Fake images of them? No answer or explanations found here. First at all escape room is going like a oven, then a cold icy area, then all rooms are reverse from bottom to at top and further situation going on endless. It seems that the only aim of escape room is to kill the participants anyhow, no matter of prize money! End is also unrealistic. How game designer know that the last survival are planning to board a plane to reach their headquarters? Here are many questions are unanswered. This movie only keeps you busy in erratic situation and use mind to survive yourself. No logic no explanation required here. Only watch with leaving brain at your home. Then you definitely enjoy this just stupid like movie. You must watch this if you are ready to watch without brain and none of question will be asked till the end. Then go it is for you. Actors and actresses are horrible, that not perfect as role demand. Then again I said leave acting aside only watch unstoppable crazy killing brain less drama. High ratings are wrong.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Saw meets brain teaser! The film was tense throughout, the characters were well acted and the story was actually very original. The fact the entire film was based on puzzles and word play made it fun throughout. A sequel wouldn't go amiss!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: There are definitely influences by the Saw movies and a little of final destination in there which is great. They pulled those two together in a unique way and just made it a fantastic movie. I've seen reviews that it also has influences from the movie The Box, but I've never seen it so I can't vouch for that one. The actors were great and each room was so unique and puzzling. It seemed to go from one thing to the next in nonstop action, which is what I love in a movie like this. There was never a dull moment.The only reason I didn't give it a 10/10 was because of the ending, although I could see them setting it up for a second movie which I would be pleased to watch! I also wished they would have showed the other contestants receiving their boxes since they only showed the few and how they came across theirs. You can assume the ones they didn't show received them in a similar fashion, but it still leaves you wondering.Other than those two bits that could have been better, it still was an intense movie to watch and would recommend to anybody.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This was surprisingly good. It is more an edge of your seat thriller than a horror movie. Apart from the geek virgin, the characters were not the usual stereotypes either. It could perhaps have been a bit more gory but I guess they covet that 15 rating.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I really wanted to like this, the trailer made it look interesting. And, wow, did I hate it. From the very first scene, I could tell I was in for a long night. It portrays one guy in an escape room, fighting for his life, as the walls are literally closing in. Every action is narrated -- Like he would be spouting exposition in a life or death situation. What's worse, it is ADR-ed to death, so not a moment goes by without him yammering. This scene took me right out of the movie.Escape Room steals aspects of Saw, Cube, Cabin in the Woods, and Hostel, and slaps on the "escape room" motif. Major studio: Real PC, plus an amalgam of previous ideas repurposed. There's a horror movie trope that should have applied here: The black guy who "takes command" (yet was the absolute last person to realize they were IN the escape room), and barks orders at people throughout this running time, yeah, he should've been the first to go. Really, this is a whole group of annoying characters, bickering with each other constantly (I'll bring up the ADR additions again) -- People in the foreground will be arguing, and seemingly a dozen other voices will be in the background conflicting with each other. Definitely overkill on this aspect.I was so distracted by the character annoyances, that the puzzles and rooms took a back seat. I can tell you the ending where the police show up could not possibly have been more predictable (cliche, really), and of course the PC police strike gold with SPOILER the mousy black girl who rebels, gets all defiant and empowered, figures the entire thing out, and is one step ahead of the lunatics/geniuses who put the whole thing together. You go, girl!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: My first impression of this film was that it was riddled with ridiculous elements. The characters are cliches, the dialogue is dumb, the acting is at best mediocre and the direction is horrible. I almost turned it off, but I'm glad I didn't. I would almost swear (if I didn't know how ridiculous the notion is) that they shot and edited this chronologically, and everyone needed about 10 scenes before the started to know what they were doing, because the film picks up at about 20 minutes in. Everything just seemed to get better, the dialogue, the acting, the characters. Or maybe, and more likely, the plot just took off, and I decided to ignore the dumb little things and just go with it. At about 35 minutes in I was thoroughly entertained. To be clear, this is not a brilliant movie. It's a thrilling semi horror flick, pretty clearly intended for teenagers, something of a retread of ideas from other YA films, and at 15 years old I would have absolutely loved the hell out of this film. At 31, I quite simply enjoyed myself.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Although the beginning of the movie kind of ruins the whole thing with showing you the end first, it held my interest throughout. A good thriller and good puzzles. Not the best but certainly not the worst.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I like these types of movies, reminds me of the old "Cube" movies, interesting.The only thing that ticked me off, was the ending, when, Ben, explains, he got a job, for Logan Square, Vegan Dog Food, yeah that's one way of killing dogs... They're Carnivores, not freakin' Vegetarians, nothing on the planet annoys me more than human Vegetarians i think, they're clueless..."If a Vegan / Vegetarian, eats a Meat eating plant, will he or she then becomes less damn annoying?!"Recommended watch, it's a nice ride of a movie, keeping you entertained from start to finish, not a dull moment!!! :)

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I don't know why this film gets so many low ratings . I was in the edge of my seat from the beginning until the end . The acting is not oscar worthy but it's decent , the rooms are great with my favourite being the 8 ball room. Some gave a low rating because of the ending, I personally liked it because after watching it i wanted the see the second immediately . I even saw it again just to see the little details i missed in the first time . Also if you expect a scary movie with tons of gore like Saw this is not for you . This more of a mystery thriller than horror . If you want to have fun with friends this is my number 1 reccomendation .

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room. Oh boy.. I do not know really know what to write expect for the point that it was pretty bad. It was very slow and it didn't have the write amount of horror and action and drama we expected from this movie. The movie was so terrible and slow that I actually left the theater and had to get a full refund. If you want to see this then you see this but I highly recommend you don't because it will just be a waste of time.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Now that its a new year, its time for a new year in movies. January is often known as the month where bad movies are released. Escape Room sort of looked like it could fall into that category, but I had interest in this. This was particularly because I have done an escape room a few times (although I've never escaped). Having seen this film, I wish for everyone to ignore what critics say this was actually a solidly entertaining time. About the best possible scenario for a first week of January film.The film is about six different people who are invited to take part in an escape room, one that is billed as the best and toughest one out there. Soon the participants realize that their task isn't just a game and that its a game of survival with death being the consequence. They also soon realize that their selection to participate isn't as random as they initially anticipated. The film is directed by Adam Robitel, the same person responsible for Insidious: The Last Key, which I hated.The rooms and challenges are for the most part clever. Sure, some of the solving of the clues are fast and improbable but suspend that belief and enjoy. Its a really fun time especially for a film that operates with a PG-13 rating. Who would have thought that a film based on a popular social game could actually be really good? It has all the elements of what you would expect from a mystery-thriller so its a good time in the cinemas and a good start to 2019.The film does get messy towards the end, of course you can't really expect this thing to be perfect and without any faults. Also, I really disliked the way the film shamelessly tries to set up for a sequel when it would be better as a one and done, especially since it exceeded expectations. Overall, go see it and judge it for yourself because I feel like this is a picture that will get criticism before people attempt to experience it for themselves.7/10

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This is a very interestig film. I was one the edge most of the time while watching this.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Terrible film... acting was poor, typical US TV idea that is so ridiculous and lacking. Typical bunch of a gang of people who each has a character trait and their own demons, that it was insulting to watch. Even the ending was crap... Typical "Look out behind you!" pantomime setting.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This was supposed to be a mystery thriller. I guess like the series Saw or The Cube/ The exam. It is about some guys that are invited "randomly" to an escape room and they try to figure the way out and the reasons behind it. The story is very predictable which is sad to say the least, the acting is pretty bad as well and I'm not saying this from an elitist viewpoint because the actors aren't A tier, it's very below average. The viewer can't really search for clues in the movie which is kinda disappointing as well.There is a twist somewhere but it isn't worth the time. If you are like me and expect a Saw tier movie or actual mystery thriller, you will get very very disappointed from this. As a big fan of the genre, I had to see it but I wish I hadnt

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Where do I start and where do I end?I've never been so thrilled by a movie spanning over 90 minutes of suspense. Job well done by the producers and directors. If I could I would give it 11 stars.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I went into this film not expecting much, just a bit of fun, and I'm also generally not into horror films. However, I was surprised at how well the main characters were written and that they were each given a backstory with compelling motivations and personalities. It wasn't completely perfect, at times Danny seemed like a bit of a charicature of a geek, but even then that wasn't overdone too much. And Mike wasn't given quite as much spotlight as the others, but the other 4 characters I thought were written and acted very well.I also enjoyed the creative puzzles and how they solved them, having done a few escape rooms before I could see the puzzles are similar to an actual escape room (although the stakes are a bit more extreme in this case!)Overall, I really enjoyed watching this and now I want to see the second one!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
Lots of twists from the start
Well acted and well played out
Great movie and just the right time frame

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Except for the ending the movie was good and engaging

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I actually watched the sequel first which made me want to watch this one due to having some issues with the second movie. I wanted to see if those would be resolved by watching the first.It is a typical take on a group of people trying to survive and escape these puzzle rooms and try not to die. You could argue similar movies are Saw and Follow Me.All characters seemed alright; I actually liked the different dynamic for all of them. Ben (who ends up surviving) was actually my least favorite which made the ending a little meh. Zoey gets kind of too attached to Amanda; I don't know why you'd be super devastated over some stranger you just met dying but okay.The twist with Zoey actually surviving was a bit predictable since the movie pushes for her to be the center character but the way she does is a bit questionable. I liked that they took time to figure these puzzles out (mostly Zoey did) and that the first "solution" wasn't always the right one.It's a decent watch but it's not something that you'd enjoy more than once.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
Two flicks with the same title. One from 2017 and this one from 2019. This is the better one. A mixture of a normal escape room and Saw.It does have an open ending an guess what, 2021 the follow up will come out.Is it worth checking out. Well if you are out for some gore and red stuff, forget it, it's all about suspense. People do die that's for sure but towards the end you will get the feeling that Saw comes in.One to check out for the effects. The upside down room is one to discover and to see for the camera tricks used.So after all not a bad one.
Gore 0/5
Nudity 0/5
Effects 2,5/5
Story 3/5
Comedy 0/5

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: The first part of the movie is really good and has a lot of potential. But getting close to the end they should have stopped the movie when the duo escapes. That would have been a more complete ending with them not being outsiders anymore, but having found eachother

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
First half was great..
Ending was pure nonsense..Great cast..
Great plot..
Great thriller..
Stupid stupid ending..Many things left unexplained half of those explained dont make senseIt's a nice movie but the stupid senseless ending is sure to make intelligent people angry

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I almost didn't end up watching this, but it turned out to be a great choice! There was an escape room movie that isn't this one that I believe was just a low budget Netflix effort that was cashing in on escape rooms being the hot new thing, popping up in every city. This one absolutely blew the other one out of the water.Is it that believable? The answer is no. But they had the budget to really build some incredible scenes in each "room" and I was perfectly happy to turn a blind eye to believability because I felt the execution was phenomenal.The different rooms/challenges were really intense, really well thought through, and the actors all did a great job portraying individual characters that you can actually get behind and empathize with.The ending was a bit trash I thought, just a joyless attempt at leaving the door open for a sequel, but the rest was awesome.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room is not the worst movie on the planet but compared with the first two Cube or Saw movies it is a rather underachieving one - the longer the movie moves on the more dragged everything feels and after the first excitment I went to a rather slightly bored mode.Not that bad, production and acting is solid, but to sum it up: Escape Room is rather a pretty standard movie with only a few highlights here and there. Not great but watchable.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Why oh why are films like this even made? its so bad I cant even find the energy to tell you how bad it is.It distresses me to think my hard earnt money is spent on this rubbish.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: It was a cool concept! I found the main characters likeable and the actors did really well. For the most part, in my opinion the movie was not predictable and kept me on my toes, however, there were some parts, which I thought were a bit slow-paced and could've been more interesting and suspenseful. But having been to escape rooms myself, I felt eerily reminded of the riddles and everything.All in all, the ending of the movie left one wondering. I'm definitely curious about the sequel and want to know more about the background of the escape room.I would recommend watching, it's a good thriller!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: The psychological games are well designed. The script is poorly executed. Acting is really really bad. Once they're inside the escape room the movies vibe stays exactly the same throughout the entire movie. No build-up tension. Nothing. So out of boredom I started to analyze the performances of the actors. They acted too dramatic imo and it just didn't seem real enough. For example: they're in this cold environment, but none of the actors were able to portray a realistic performance of a person who's suffering from hyperthermia. For me this was the moment I lost interest.Let's take 'Alita: Battle Angle' for example, despite being a somewhat shallow sci-fi flick this movie gave me an overall entertaining vibe. Escape Room simply does not! So I left the cinema dissatisfied..To sum it up: poorly executed script + bad acting = your typical cheap nonsensical Hollywood Garbage Movie.On a positive note: I loved seeing Deborah Ann Woll, she's a rare on-screen gem imo. She's the only reason I'll rate this movie 4 stars.*English isn't my native language

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
The first hour of the movie was really good. Much better than expected. The rooms were creative and funny. Then it went crazy during third act.
It's this kind of movie, where writers come up with a good pitch, but have no idea of how to end the story.
By the way, the movie is full of plot convenience. For example: What would have happened if more people went in the last room (the one with the hallucinogen) ? Luckily for the plot, they were only 2 guys left...

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: The title says it all. I'd pass on this one. If you want to watch people escape trap rooms, just watch SAW.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Escape Room is a psychological horror film directed by Adam Robitel and stars Taylor Russell, Logan Miller, Deborah Ann Woll, Tyler Labine, Jay Ellis and Nik Dodani.To be honest i was absolutely disappointed by this movie and this movie is utterly disappointing and agonizing and apart from giving a hint of possible sequel the movie serves nothing purposeful in terms of horror or entertainment.The plot of the movie the movie revolves around the life of six people.who were invited for a game to escape from rooms in order to earn $10,000. To escape from the rooms it requires some sports which includes clues, the fun game soon turns into scare and shock as some of them starts loosing their life.The acting is weirdly bad and it seems that the acting is been done by some amateurs, Taylor Russell and Jay Ellis were the most annoying followed by Nik Dodani and Deborah Ann Woll. The screenplay is irritating and the constant fight among all six of them will make you more irritating, Climax of the movie doesn't excites and as mentioned earlier just gives a glimpse of another sequal in making.With gawky direction and dilettante acting this movie is nothing but a fine example of how to waste your precious 100 minutes. There will a section of viewers who will brag about praising this movie but well in that case i am happily on the another side, for me this is nothing but a crap of 100 minutes, please escape if you can.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Starts off okay, but looses it's way mid way through and towards the end it's terrible. Sets itself up for a possible dodgy sequel. Entertaining enough, but pretty poor.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I've always been enchanted by the idea of escape rooms. Always wanted to do one, just never had the chance. Ironically enough, this movie only enhanced my desire to do one. A very likeable and familiar cast serves their purpose through the twist and turns of a thriller that follows the now formulaic nature of the genre. Everyone gets a mysterious invite, enticed by money, and chaos ensues. Film flies by with a great mix of mystery, suspense, and action. An enjoyable time. Got to try one of these rooms soon.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
As a Concept, "Escape Room" doesn't yield anything new per se; but it bedazzles in its Execution! A competent thriller that is appealing, spirited & wholly entertaining!
All at the same time!I always look for captivating thrillers.
In this booming list of films; sometimes it gets difficult to find any. Luckily I bumped into 'Escape Room'.
The intellection albeit pretty similar to what SaW & Cube conferred way back at 2000's; what I absolutely admire is its approach for unfolding the same substance in disparate manner.
Puzzles are well structured, the visuals complimenting the same. Rendering distinctive ambience & tonalities with the help of versatile color palettes; the cinematography deserves a bucket load of praise.Story sets off on a breathless note and continues in similar fashion until it reaches its conclusion. Stakes being always high, it rarely loosen up on its steam. And that's truly commendable. The characters might have been deprived of germane backstories to support their individual personalities but on a relevance scale they did work absolutely fine.Performances are quite ordinary; but a sparkling chemistry shared between this group is something to take a note of.
I can't elaborate on the exact reason, but They all coagulated so well together.
Perhaps a great selection in casting paid off. The Soundscore had a rather contemporary influence; could be annoying to few. Personally I didn't mind much as I was too invested with the story and its persuasive progression.
My only indisposition is about the climax. Probably the solitary reason I didn't give it a higher rating! Gaping at how remarkably things were going up until the finale; my expectency had already gone up. Guess what? it let me down. Even though I distaste about how it ended; I understand their credulous intensions of setting themselves up for a probable sequel.And if that ever comes up; count me in!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I totally hate it it's awful it is very annoying to watch it has that kind of an exciting thing but it is very annoying I hate it totally!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I was into this thriller - despite some of the predictable stuff - and then it lost me in the last few minutes. It's never good when the epilogue to a movie ruins the other hour and 50 minutes. This was never going to be a movie that you remembered a weekmafter seeing it, but I enjoyed it enough to give it a lukewarm recommendation.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Ending PISSED me off. Was a decent horror thriller until then. Im seriously supposed to believe these two younger characters who have now narrowly escaped death twice are taking it upon themselves to just show up at this extremely powerful companies headquarters and take them down? Uh what? And then im supposed to believe this company had the surveillance to know of the plan, and then the funding and time to build a giant plane trap simulator, and test run it with actors? And then what? They hijacked the plane these two are going to board and rig it to be an escape room? How does that make any sense

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
I went into this movie thinking and pre judging a 3/10
I was surprised how solid this movie was, good acting and pretty decent story line with excellent pacing never wasting a scene.
Good production value.
Worth an hour and a half of your time.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: The movie start with amazing effect and surprisingly good opening, but after that full of not necessary flash back scene! Make me asleep! Most intense scene is the two winner fight with the game master and kill him at the end! Another wasting time to watch horror film! Not recommended!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: My son and I were actually laughing at the cliche characters and poor writing. No one is likeable and the only decent actor is killed off early! Don't waste your money

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Quite enjoyed Escape Room for the most part. Acting and direction were good, cinematography was nice, set design was well done, intricate puzzles and intriguing character backstories that help keep you interested; pretty immersive film.The last 10 minutes killed it a bit though, could of easily cut all of that out and the film would have ended on a fairly satisfactory note. They used the last 10 minutes to set up a sequel, but I just don't think it was necessary to be honest.Overall a pretty decent effort though, if you enjoy films like Saw and Cube then you should enjoy this one as well.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Deserves the worst movie prize; in all senses. Horrible actors; cheesy; stupid confusing story lines. Makes absolutely no sense at all. Someone got paid to give good reviews here...

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: 10/10 for someone, why? Did you sleep through half of the movie? I thought in escape rooms you are working together and share all the info, you shouldn't be keeping anything away. First room and all the weights... You could solve it in different ways. And all this "let's try this" when they know it could make the situation worse is weird. Staying sweat in -30-40° in shirt for so long and one of them even passed out but only till the doors open and he's ready to run. Escape room specialist for some reason drop under the ice and moving away - for some reason everybody start blaming guy who should loose on foot. How they decide what the game is about in each room is really strange how could you come up that lock asking for 2nd word of band which was playing when you crash car with your friends few ours years later all this by letters on trophies. All those cliffhangers were plain stupid and they're killing chars just to eliminate them for next room. Room with antidote - so if noone dies only two would have the poison magically get to you through skin. How come that the first guy didn't have symptoms till then 2nd guy touched it? Why not to use half of the antidote and share with 2nd guy? Good that the last room was so easy that grocery guy could solve it even he got the nomination for the game by throwing the black cube out the ground and mostly not came up with anything apart magically guess trophies. Ok in "win" room last guy was higher... But really you can lift up and strangle adult at least 75kg heavy adult fighting for life? Well he wasn't really human since ebony shot him twice and he teleported from only place he could hide with his large body and still be able to attack that girl. For some reason they had visible cams only in rooms and not in the rest of the complex. If you make a movie about solving puzzles you should avoid this mistakes and think it through. I'm not sure, that if I'm business man with own office and assistant I would be interested to spend my time to win $10k. Everything is times so if you like this "stress out" Scarry movies which don't really have deep meaning and you just want to discuss it with bunch of people and making fun of it - go for it. Don't expect much otherwise and really don't fall for those high rating review.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This movie is very entertaining and thrilling you don't want to take your eyes of the screen , hope you enjoy it . I think it os really under rated. The acting the rooms the idea was great.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This flick turned out to be a gem for me and my wife; a little over the top.... but what in this type of genre isn't? It's hollywood.....the land where over the top sells. this has the potential for a good franchise

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: My God, I've never heard so much yelling in one movie in all my life.The acting is TERRIBLE. Deborah Ann Woll overacting as usual. Five other actors I've never heard of, what did I expect? To be fair Taylor Russell did well, this is the first time I have seen her. See was believable as the socially awkward quantum physics student, until the script decided she should yell "breathe b!tch!!" and she all of a sudden knows how to wield a handgun.The escape room fanatic character that has done 90+ escape rooms.. dies first. FFS. Come on.This movie had a lot of potential until all the super loud talking and screaming started. The plot and rooms at that point just get jumbled and messy. Hard to follow along with everyone yelling at the top of their lungs.Oh and the ending, OMEGAH THE ENDING. Would have been kinda cool if the games master was Jigsaw. Instead they hint at a sequel. Go do a real escape room instead of wasting your time with this garbage.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: 6/10 - this captivating storyline did indeed have its flaws, but it was still thrilling and enjoyable

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Very clever, keeps you guessing the whole time and it draws a viewer in, almost as if a member of an audience is one of the players, which I applaud. There are a few loose ends and a room left for a sequel (no pun intended). A story is no nonsense, simple and very well executed. I recommend it to horor fans and puzzle solving enthusiasts.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Pretty much sums up this film, which I just seen a preview of tonight.The film starts with 6 young 20 somethings being brought together to take part in a mysterious Escape Room event. Each of them was the soul survivor of an horrific accident in their past lives, but each of these strangers has no idea why they were selected, or whose is behind it the event in the first place. So as you'd know, the group are put into an escape room, & there follows the typical traits of an escape room, find clues & figure out how to escape the room. But this room leads to another & then clues & revelations of their pasts start to unfold as the film goes on.I found the film to be pretty decent. It had the Saw & Belko Experiment themes going on & I can't help but feel the Now You See Me Films have a sort of reference in this mind**** of a film along with Hellraiser also playing a role too. It had a solid ending which leaves a door open for a sequel. (I hope!)But my complaints of the film were that it wasn't gory, in fact, it was almost bloodless. Reason for my complaint on that was the kind of promise that this was going to be like Saw. Now although I know full well this was a 15+, I still feel the gore could've been kicked up to a near Saw standard. I also felt the deaths were pretty crap & unimaginative, I mean, this film had the potential to make the death sequences unique given how unique the sets & rooms were in this film.The film was pretty much a dulled down version of what Saw is pretty much. It's solid, unique & entertaining, but could've been gorier & more fast paced, the film dragged a bit to be honest. I also felt the film went off the rails a bit & could've been more grounded.But overall it was a pretty decent film. It had both good & bad points to it, but it was unique in its own right. Though it could've been gorier, with the deaths being better & more grounded topped with a fast paced treatment.7/10

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I for one was sucked into this movie through curiosity. A movie about escape room(s) that will literally kill you? I am so in. While the movie does lend itself some really good ideas those ideas seem very bare minimum. While all the actors are really good everything around them is not.A very predictable plot that you could probably guess right off the get go. And despite the cast giving it their all the characters in this movie lack more development, some times they all come off as a-holes, and other times you wanna root for them.The escape room ideas themselves don't seem as fleshed out enough, they could have been more interesting ideas around this premise but it all felt very standard. while tense in some places, the pacing didn't let you sink in that time to really feel that suspense.Average movie overall with a good premise and good acting, but very little in terms of interest. I might watch it again if its on, but its not something I'd recommend unless you were really curious about this type of movie premise.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I expected a cheesy, cheap thrills, with jumpy scare tactics throughout movie. Instead I got something very different. I actually got a movie that had pretty good character development. One that made me care about each character enough to not want any of them to die. It actually makes you want to know more about their backstory.Each scene was pretty well thought out and didn't feel too rushed except the ending, which I felt was a bit rushed. I liked how each character didn't just look out for themselves but actually cared about the group. It showed that humanity can care for more, which is a message I definitely didn't expect to see in a movie like this.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Can anyone make a proper movie on this planet or are we out of ideas? Awful.Oh, and the writing... At the start the black dude mentions Mr Miyagi and then mocks his employee who hasn't heard of him. "Jesus what year were you born kid." The actor who played the black dude was born in freaking 1981, he was TWO when Karate Kid came out.Awful script, awful directing, awful movie.

After forty minutes of watching this crapfest, I turned it off and deleted it from computer. The cast was so annoying, the acting is ridiculous and I just couldn't take watching them any longer. I so hate these lying reviews saying how good this film is, when in actuality, It's simply awful.....Avoid

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
What a complete waste of 1hr 40mins. A very bad, & boring Saw attempt... dont writers have any original ideas these day? They just seem to steal others. The characters are abysmal. You don't care about any of them, they are all annoying and the over acting is cringeworthy.
The whole thing just made me angry for wasting my time!

Title: Escape Room

BUT, it was good stuff. The cast were good, story was steady and moved at just the right pace. Definitely put it on your Netflix list.

Title: Escape Room

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Zoey passed out, so how did she manage to reach the oxygen? The other guy was trapped in a narrow space he shouldn't have the capability of escaping, especially surrounded by all the furniture. Two plot holes that leave the end of the movie as something that doesn't make sense.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: I admit, the starting scene turned me off. Didn't build intrigue or tension, just was annoying with some guy yelling to himself while he solved the room. But film got a lot better after that for quite a while, it certainly had potential, but then it kind of wore on, the rooms were interesting of course, but too much hysterics. Each character was a stereotype. I would dearly have loved to have see a surprising twist at the end, something to go "wow" didn't see that, something that would make a puzzle movie worthy. Alas.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: The plot for this movie seems to have been done to death with slight variation over the last couple of years. Surely someone can come up with something new.The movie was far to frenetic, the music intrusive, the acting was mostly melodramatic at best and hammy at worst. Half the cinema had walked out by the third room as it was just more of the same.If was just ok.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content:
My husband and I definitely loved it!
We didn't have to see nudity or a bunch of gore everywhere for it to be a great film! The actors did really well with their acting. The ending has a great spin to it! I I can definitely re watch this again and enjoy it like how I did the first time. Love the movie.
We are ready for the second one!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Don't listen to the snobby critics reviews, this is an amazing and suspenseful movie! I just love the fact that they can make a movie suspenseful,scary, and fun to watch, yet also keeping the pg-13 rating, overall I would definitely recommend you watch it!

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: In comparison to other January thrillers, Escape Room definitely stands out against the others. It excels ahead of Insidious: The Last Key, The Bye Bye Man, The Forest, And The Woman In Black 2: Angel Of Death, which are all January releases. Granted, Escape Room isn't amazing, not even great, but it is definitely a step forward in the right direction. I would definitely recommend this if you like thrillers, and if you are on the fence, go see it. It's not great, but if you go in not expecting much, it's pretty enjoyable.The first thing that really stands out is the set design. Each of the rooms has its own distinctive style, filled up with small objects that make the rooms feel more realistic, but not too crowded. They feel like real escape rooms, and each room was thought out as to how they would affect a certain character and their thoughts. The characters were also fine, the movie did just the right amount of backstory, providing enough information so we know the characters and some of their backstories, but not too much so the thrills don't get bogged down by an overload of emotions. The actors themselves do an okay job, the standouts being Deborah Ann Woll and Logan Miller. The only really bad performance was Nik Dodani, but it was obvious that no thought was really put into the character, because he was just a throwaway. The deaths in the movie were also good, because there wasn't much of a focus on the gore (to keep the PG-13 rating) but it actually works out, so the movie doesn't really slow down at any point to show bleeding out characters, or have long emotional scenes. There is really only one sentimental death, but it also doesnt stay too long on that. The brisk pace of the movie keeps everything going, never stopping, so it stays entertaining. That alone is probably the best part of the movie, it never loses it entertainment value. It's fun to watch characters solve their way through the rooms, just narrowly escaping death. Even though the characters are very one dimensional, you still root for them. The last great thing about this movie is that it knows what it is. It doesn't try to be a super sophisticated twisty thriller. There were so many opportunities for it to have huge twists, but it ignored those, and just kept moving along. That made the movie a lot easier to enjoy.The movie does falter though, and it does especially during the third act. There are huge plot holes that leave so many questions, and that aspect was really frustrating. It became unrealistic at one point, and there were just lazy excuses made to cover it up. This all happened toward the end, which factors into the ending. I personally don't think that the ending was as terrible as everyone says, but it still wasn't very good. It spent the final minutes setting up for a sequel, instead of creating a satisfying conclusion. It just branches farther and farther out, making a million different possibilities for sequels and franchises. Even though the ending was bad, I'd go pay to see the sequelOverall, I'd definitely recommend Escape Room. It's isn't great, but it is better then most January movies, and if you like horror movies or thrillers, go see this. If you go into it with no expectations whatsoever, you'll probably come out pleasantly surprised.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: This film is well made and produced and has some great suspenseful scenes. It looks like it was a complicated film to make but no expense was spared and I liked the ending too it shows it's an ambitious effort with a potential for a sequel.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Better than a lot of it's predecessors such as Saw and Cube, but down on the best of it's type, Final Destination. Switch your brain off from all the contrived nonsense and get past the dullish opening 15 minutes or so, which has clearly been edited down because you bizarrely only get some backstories and not others, thankfully, then sit back and enjoy what is a McDonalds to cuisine, you know it isn't particularly good, but you can't help but enjoy it, then ignore the terrible last 15 minutes of the film, that does it's utmost to ruin the fun.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Well, this can keep the audience guessing through entire movie. And the twisting end is being perfectly done

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: It's directed so well, and it has great little scenes that build up to the deaths in a unique and realistic way, also, the production value is incredible, it looks a lot bigger budget than it was.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Exactly one year after his last feature film that saw him ending (fingers-crossed) the outlived Insidious franchise, Adam Robitel returns to begin another franchise that surely will not have the lifespan of the one it is imitating. He delivers a pilot installment that maybe only Jason Blum would be proud of, hitting various Blumhouse beats with more enthusiasm than even last year's game-to-film adaption Truth or Dare managed. These Blumian (a descriptor I am pained to invent) tropes include characters reading aloud text like a zealous mother, a clunky ten minute group ice-breaking session that clinically checks all the expository boxes, and the "twist-ception(s)".Six individuals all receive the same elegantly quirky puzzle box from colleagues and loved ones. Ben, a grocery boy, attempts to use brute force to open the cube, while Zoey, a physics student scribbles diagrams and notes as she unlocks what is an invitation to the world's most immersive escape room. Jason, a financial wizard, utilizes YouTube tutorials to crack his gift, and apparently the $10,000 prize for escaping still appeals to a man who initially expected a Prius key when his package first arrived. After all the participants are gathered in a waiting room of a seemingly barren high-rise, we're introduced to a happy-go-lucky trucker dad, a gamer boy turned escape room enthusiast, and an intimidating woman (her caricature is revealed later) rounding out the players now trapped in what will become an architecturally perplexing series of rooms.The clues scattered throughout the rooms are just barely more subtle than the hints plopped into the dialogue revealing the unifying trait of all the participants. It is far from a spoiler to comment on how painfully obvious that the escape room is more a social experiment than a game. However, our gamer boy Danny tries his darndest to immerse us into the game by effectively giving a "Escape Rooms 101" lecture to the gang. Trucker dad Mike eats this up with great appreciation as will many audiences who aren't privy to the new entertainment craze. This goes beyond exposition dumping, and feels eerily similar to an in-game tutorial, which oddly enough, doesn't feel right in a movie.Where the film lacks creativity in character development, its set design flourishes with imaginative decisions that tie into the players' pasts with relative frequency, providing a human anchor to an otherwise procedural death trot similar to the cult beloved Cube. An upside down jukebox bar steals the show by offering the most integrated use of clues worthy of an indie walking simulator game remake. But collect all the rooms together, and the difficulty curve resembles a goose bump: not challenging in the slightest. I knew that this would be where this film lived or died, and it perished early into the first room when I hacked the game's system and saw a much more efficient solution involving glasses and a couch. I effectively mentally speed-ran the rooms in an effort to milk joy from my viewing.If predictability is the film's greatest sin, then the dialogue is the lesser sin. The performances from the auxiliary characters are particularly rigid, but this too can be blamed on down-right lazy writing that at one point has a college professor give our wiz kid Zoey an extracurricular homework assignment of "doing one thing that scares you". Yet I'm still fearful of a potentially greater sin lurking in the closing moments of what I'll call the fourth act of an otherwise brisk movie: the sequel(s) option. The same blue-balls Netflix original series "binge me some more daddy" gut punch arose, and now SONY's plan was revealed. Once again, I do not view this as being in the spoiler family, because what is inevitable is inevitable.Now only time will tell if they can rise to sustained success that Twisted Pictures basked in with the 8-film series chronicling a sinister puzzle designer. The difference here is tragically obvious, Escape Room's puzzle designer is totally morally deprived. There must be a method to the madness, this mastermind only has business propelling their madness, which I'm saddened to report doesn't generate the intriguing tension between torturer and victim that its gorier predecessors at least attempted to balance. Speaking of gore, my first "so PG-13 is what we're going to do?" badge of 2019 goes to this gem for copying the formula, but diluting it in the process. A worthy excuse to create a dungeon crawler thriller I will admit, but contrary to gamer boy Danny's hilariously ignorant exclamation after barely evading flames, this one is far from immersive.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Even if it is a small-production type film, it can really have a good quality, so that a lot of domestic garbage money is even more shameful. The whole room environment design is good, but the riddles are too straight and there is no decryption step, and then the death method is too ordinary and not irritating. The final white-left counterattack is to lower the overall quality.

Title: Escape Room
Reviewer_Content: Out of the 3-4 escape room movies I've seen, this is one of the best. Sure, the premise of this film is nothing new, and yes the acting is a bit weak at times, but the characters were still effective within their particular roles and/or type of people they represented. What I liked was how details about the characters were presented, how they were used as a nexus to tie the characters to specific puzzle elements in each of the rooms. The Escape Room was more original from other movies I've seen of this type. Lastly, the level of action from start to finish was good, and it kept me watching to see what would happen next. I thought Panic Room was more than a reasonably entertaining bit of escapism for my brain.

Title: Escape Room
